resources.string: Spacious, modern destination for high-end steak and cocktails with glitzy decor and a rooftop patio.
Big portions of hot stone Korean BBQ, tofu stews and sides amongst no-frills decor in a strip mall.

Since we first opened in 2001, Tajima has been satisfying San Diego\'s growing hunger for authentic Japanese cuisine and ramen that is both unique and flavorful. Thanks to owner Sam Morikizono and his talented staff, Tajima has earned a reputation as one of San Diego\'s top Japanese restaurants.

City Tacos has turned up the heat on innovative, delicious and unique bites. We prepare fresh Mex as it should be… “con sazón!” You’ll find a special blend of positivity and seasoning here that makes our food pop! Born in San Diego’s North Park neighborhood, City Tacos now proudly serves the communities of La Mesa and Imperial Beach. Our three locations are dedicated to combining traditional recipes with SoCal flavor to make our tacos unique. Meat, fish, vegetarian, even Paleo offerings offer something for every taste. Our dishes can also be topped with a variety of creative salsas to customize each bite. At the end of the day, we believe that food should be a celebration

Our first San Diego restaurant is located at the University Town Center. This all-American scratch kitchen doesn’t just stop with their handmade gourmet burgers and menu using locally sourced produce. Eureka!’s small batch whiskey, extensive rotating craft beer and beverage program is something all beer lovers will enjoy. With a stacked weekly calendar they provide a one-of-a-kind experience for guests with half off wine Tuesdays, Steal The Glass Wednesdays, Live Music Thursdays, a daily “Hoppy Hour” and weekend brunch. If you’re looking for a place with all-American food, the best craft beer selection and the best whiskey bar in San Diego, then Eureka!, you’ve found

Experience the best of San Diego nightclubs at Onyx Room. Located in the heart of downtown San Diego, Onyx Room brings world class DJs, a fun, vibrant dance club atmosphere, and the best bottle service San Diego has to offer. Make a reservation today.

The Local Eatery and Drinking Hole opened its doors in 2003, as a family owned and operated restaurant and bar. Mina Desiderio saw an opportunity to carve out a niche in the Financial District of Downtown San Diego. The philosophy was simple: Bring the beach and all things that define San Diego to downtown. The vision was to be an establishment that supported local sports teams, local cuisine, local beers, local music and local events, hence the name, The Local.

Our rooftop overlooks Pacific Beach. Our gourmet tacos are made with fresh, local ingredients and served in house-made tortillas. Our bar features a large selection of tequilas, with 18 beers on tap. We have 24 HD TVs and a giant projection screen. There’s no place on the boardwalk like us. Our bar was built on the concept of Dia de los Muertos. Combine all of these elements, and El Prez is where to drink, where to eat and where to party in San Diego!

erched 22 stories above the historic Gaslamp District, ALTITUDE Sky Lounge is an elite rooftop bar in San Diego, pairing stunning panoramic views with a sleek, modern atmosphere complete with a blazing fire pit and can’t-miss happy hour. The bar offers bottle service; a fine selection of wine, beer and cocktails; an impressive array of appetizers, flatbreads, burgers and more.
Apothecary-esque bar offers craft cocktails and microbrews in a stylish, retro space with an atrium.

Surrounded by shops and restaurants along San Diego Bay, this high-end hotel is 9 minutes\' walk from the San Diego Convention Center and 3 miles from San Diego International Airport.Featuring floor-to-ceiling windows with bay or city views, upscale rooms offer free Wi-Fi and flat-screens; studios add pull-out sofas. Club rooms provide access to a private lounge serving complimentary breakfast, while suites come with kitchenettes and living rooms. Room service is available. Dining options include a seafood restaurant, a buffet eatery with a terrace, and a rooftop lounge and bar. There\'s also a spa and a gym, as well as 2 outdoor pools.

Set on Mission Bay, this relaxed resort is a 12-minute walk from Belmont Park and 2.2 miles from SeaWorld San Diego. The simple, traditional rooms offer flat-screen TVs and free Wi-Fi, along with coffeemakers and minifridges. Some have beach or garden views. Suites add kitchenettes and dining tables, as well as sitting areas and bay views. Room service is available. A turn-of-the-century riverboat offers free cruises between the resort and a sister property. Dining options include a Mediterranean cafe and a Moroccan-themed lounge bar. There\'s an outdoor pool, a hot tub and a kids\' game room, along with tennis courts and live entertainment.

Across the street from the San Diego Convention Center, this polished 30-story convention hotel overlooking San Diego Bay is a 7-minute walk from Petco Park, home of the Padres baseball team, and 10 minutes\' walk from the historic Gaslamp Quarter. Airy rooms offer bay and city views, plus flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi (fee). Suites add living areas with pull-out sofas. There\'s an upscale restaurant offering innovative global dishes, as well as a sports bar, a coffee shop, and a waterfront bar with a terrace. Other amenities include a spa, a fitness center, and an outdoor saltwater pool with views of the bay, plus 165,000 sq ft of meeting space.

On a private 44-acre island with a mile of beach, this stylish resort is 2 miles from SeaWorld San Diego. Upscale rooms feature flat-screens, Wi-Fi and minifridges, plus coffeemakers and patios; some provide bay views. Suites offer sitting areas and microwaves, and some add fireplaces and whirlpool tubs. Bungalows offer separate sitting rooms and dining tables, and an upgraded suite includes a kitchen. There are 5 pools and 4 restaurants, including a breezy waterfront grill, plus a spa, a marina and an 18-hole golf course. Additional amenities include a fitness center, lawn games, and tennis and basketball courts. Parking is available (fee).

A 5-minute walk from buses, trains and trolleys at the Santa Fe Depot, this polished hotel is a mile from shopping and dining at the Gaslamp Quarter, and 3 miles from the gardens of Balboa Park. The bright, modern rooms come with Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs and coffeemakers. Upgraded rooms add sitting areas. Room service is offered. There\'s a sleek restaurant and a rooftop bar serving small plates. Other amenities include a fitness center and bike rentals.

Balboa Park is a 1,200-acre urban cultural park in San Diego, California, United States. In addition to open space areas, natural vegetation zones, green belts, gardens, and walking paths, it contains museums, several theaters, and the world-famous San Diego Zoo.
Torrey Pines is a community of 2,600 acres in the northern coastal area of San Diego, California, residential with large areas of office space along I-5.
The San Diego Zoo is a zoo in Balboa Park, San Diego, California, housing more than 3,500 animals of more than 650 species and subspecies.

Pacific Beach is a relaxed neighborhood by the beach, popular with sunbathers and surfers. Trendy hotel bars and casual cafes line the boardwalk, while Mission Boulevard and the surrounding streets are dotted with women’s clothing boutiques, yoga studios and casual drinking spots that draw a young, bar-hopping crowd. Inland, the grassy slope of Kate Sessions Park has sweeping views of the city and San Diego Bay.

Mission Bay is a human-made saltwater bay located south of the Pacific Beach community of San Diego, California created from approximately 2,000 acres of historical wetland, marsh, and saltwater bay habitat
